unnormalised: Hey folks, quick update on the dengue situation in Delhi. Seems like cases are on the rise again, especially post the monsoon. I heard from Dr. Sharma at AIIMS that they're seeing a significant increase in patients showing symptoms.
normalised: Hey folks, quick update on the dengue situation in Delhi. Seems like cases are on the rise again, especially post the monsoon. I heard from Doctor Sharma at A-I-I-M-S that they're seeing a significant increase in patients showing symptoms.

unnormalised: According to the latest report from the Ministry of Health, there's been a 20% jump in reported dengue cases in the last 2 weeks alone. They're saying it's crucial to take preventive measures like using mosquito repellent and ensuring no stagnant water accumulates around your homes. Remember those campaigns about emptying coolers and flower pots? Yeah, time to get serious about that again!
normalised: According to the latest report from the Ministry of Health, there's been a twenty percent jump in reported dengue cases in the last two weeks alone. They're saying it's crucial to take preventive measures like using mosquito repellent and ensuring no stagnant water accumulates around your homes. Remember those campaigns about emptying coolers and flower pots? Yeah, time to get serious about that again!

unnormalised: Also, remember that dengue fever can come with some nasty symptoms like high fever (reaching upto 104°F), severe body ache, and in some cases, even bleeding. If you're feeling unwell, don't just self-medicate with a Paracetamol 500mg and assume it’s a normal fever. Get yourself checked at the nearest clinic or hospital ASAP. Early diagnosis is key!
normalised: Also, remember that dengue fever can come with some nasty symptoms like high fever (reaching up to one hundred and four degree Fahrenheit), severe body ache, and in some cases, even bleeding. If you're feeling unwell, don't just self-medicate with a Paracetamol five hundred milligram and assume it’s a normal fever. Get yourself checked at the nearest clinic or hospital A-S-A-P. Early diagnosis is key!

unnormalised: The authorities are also advising fogging in affected areas and are urging people to cooperate. So let’s all do our bit to keep ourselves and our communities safe from this outbreak. Stay informed, stay vigilant, and stay healthy, bhai!
normalised: The authorities are also advising fogging in affected areas and are urging people to cooperate. So let’s all do our bit to keep ourselves and our communities safe from this outbreak. Stay informed, stay vigilant, and stay healthy, bhai!
